cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 10 miles WSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, skirting the Outer Banks then passing offshore of New England toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks of North Carolina (near Cape Hatteras)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect for Nova Scotia; Tropical-storm watch for portions of Prince Edward Island, Magdalen Islands, and coastal New Brunswick/Newfoundland
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Surf City NC to NC/VA border; Tropical-Storm Warning NC/VA border to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay south, parts of coastal MA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Large portion of the U.S. East Coast from northern Florida through North Carolina, Mid-Atlantic, and New England exposed to swell, wind, and rain
weather_observation.wind: Residual breezy conditions, occasional gusts 20–30 mph from outer gradient flow; well below tropical-storm strength
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor positive tidal anomalies possible
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall expected at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents for another 24–36 hours
